definition: end/extremity/item/port/to hold sth level with both hands/to carry/regular
owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy

sentences.english: If Egypt devolves into chaos, it will feed extremism throughout the region.
sentences.chinese: 如果埃及陷入混亂，將助長整個地區的極端主義活動。

sentences.english: He says interfaith cooperation is a way to balance extremism.
sentences.chinese: 他說，不同信仰之間的合作可以平衡極端主義。

sentences.english: The assassin was adjudged an extremist.
sentences.chinese: 那個行刺者被認爲是個極端主義分子。

sentences.english: Azhar is a leader of the Jaish-e-Mohammad extremist movement.
sentences.chinese: 艾茲哈爾是穆罕默德軍極端主義運動的領導人。

sentences.english: Extremism gives them an identity that allows them to rebel against both.
sentences.chinese: 極端主義給予了他們身份，讓他們得以叛逆這兩者。

sentences.english: The first issue that we have to confront is violent extremism in all of its forms.
sentences.chinese: 我們必須面對的第一個問題是一切形式的極端主義。

sentences.english: The United States has partnered with the countries of East Africa to counter violent extremism.
sentences.chinese: 美國與東非國家合作反抗暴力極端主義。

sentences.english: After the attacks, Britain added far-right extremism to its planning for fighting terrorism.
sentences.chinese: 襲擊發生後，英國將極右極端主義列入反恐計劃。

sentences.english: Chris Weedon s:Feminism and the principles of poststructura ltist Theory;
sentences.chinese: 有些女權主義者所持的極端主義觀點。

definition: to obscure the facts (idiom); to mislead the public with prevarication and deliberate falsehoods
